verses.kjv: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.
verses.web: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.
verses.ct: Jesus went into the synagogue again, and a man with a paralyzed hand was there.

verses.kjv: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.
verses.web: They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.
verses.ct: The religious leaders watched him closely, looking for an excuse to accuse him if he healed the man on the Sabbath.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.
verses.web: He said to the man who had his hand withered, “Stand up.”
verses.ct: Jesus told the man with the paralyzed hand, "Stand up and come to the front."

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.
verses.web: He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?” But they were silent.
verses.ct: Then he turned to the others and asked, "Which is lawful on the Sabbath — doing good or doing harm? Saving a life or killing?" No one said a word.

verses.kjv: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
verses.web: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.
verses.ct: Jesus looked around at them with anger, deeply grieved by how hard their hearts had become. Then he said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." The man stretched it out, and it was completely restored — as healthy as the other.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.web: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.ct: The Pharisees left immediately and began plotting with the Herodians about how to destroy Jesus.

verses.kjv: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,
verses.web: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,
verses.ct: Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the Sea of Galilee, and a massive crowd followed him — people from Galilee, Judaea,

verses.kjv: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and from beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.
verses.web: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.
verses.ct: Jerusalem, Idumaea, the region beyond the Jordan, and the area around Tyre and Sidon. This enormous crowd came to him because they'd heard about everything he was doing.

verses.kjv: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
verses.web: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn’t press on him.
verses.ct: He told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him so the crowd wouldn't crush him.

verses.kjv: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.
verses.web: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.
verses.ct: He had healed so many people that everyone with diseases was pushing forward just to touch him.

verses.kjv: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
verses.web: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.ct: Whenever unclean spirits saw him, they threw themselves down in front of him and screamed, "You are the Son of God!"

verses.kjv: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.
verses.web: He sternly warned them that they should not make him known.
verses.ct: But he sternly ordered them not to reveal who he was.

verses.kjv: And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth unto him whom he would: and they came unto him.
verses.web: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.
verses.ct: Jesus went up on a mountainside and called the ones he wanted, and they came to him.

verses.kjv: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
verses.web: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach,
verses.ct: He appointed 12 of them to be his closest companions and to be sent out to preach.

verses.kjv: And to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:
verses.web: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:
verses.ct: He also gave them authority to heal the sick and cast out demons.

verses.kjv: And Simon he surnamed Peter;
verses.web: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter);
verses.ct: These are the 12 he chose: Simon, whom he named Peter;

verses.kjv: And James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:
verses.web: James the son of Zebedee; and John, the brother of James, (whom he called Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder);
verses.ct: James son of Zebedee and his brother John — Jesus nicknamed them Boanerges, which means "Sons of Thunder";

verses.kjv: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,
verses.web: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;
verses.ct: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Canaanite;

verses.kjv: And Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.
verses.web: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. Then he came into a house.
verses.ct: and Judas Iscariot, who would later betray him. Then they went into a house.

verses.kjv: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
verses.web: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
verses.ct: The crowd gathered again in such numbers that Jesus and his disciples couldn't even find time to eat.

verses.kjv: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
verses.web: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him; for they said, “He is insane.”
verses.ct: When his family heard what was going on, they went to take him home by force, because they said, "He's lost his mind."

verses.kjv: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.
verses.web: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.”
verses.ct: The scribes who had come down from Jerusalem were saying, "He's possessed by Beelzebub! He drives out demons by the power of the prince of demons."

verses.kjv: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?
verses.web: He summoned them, and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
verses.ct: So Jesus called them over and spoke to them using illustrations: "How can Satan drive out Satan?

verses.kjv: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.web: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.ct: If a kingdom fights against itself, that kingdom can't survive.

verses.kjv: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.web: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.ct: If a household is torn apart by conflict, that household won't last.

verses.kjv: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.
verses.web: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.
verses.ct: So if Satan has turned against himself and is divided, he can't stand either — his end has come.

verses.kjv: No man can enter into a strong man’s house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.
verses.web: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder unless he first binds the strong man; then he will plunder his house.
verses.ct: No one can break into a strong man's house and steal his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man. Only then can he ransack the house.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: every sin and every blasphemy people commit can be forgiven.

verses.kjv: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:
verses.web: but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation.”
verses.ct: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven — that person is guilty of an eternal sin."

verses.kjv: Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.
verses.web: —because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.ct: He said this because they were claiming he had an unclean spirit.

verses.kjv: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.
verses.web: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.
verses.ct: Then his mother and brothers arrived. They stood outside and sent someone in to call him.

verses.kjv: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.
verses.web: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”
verses.ct: A crowd was sitting around Jesus, and they told him, "Your mother and your brothers are outside asking for you."

verses.kjv: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?
verses.web: He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
verses.ct: He replied, "Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?"

verses.kjv: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
verses.web: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!
verses.ct: Then he looked at the people sitting in a circle around him and said, "Here are my mother and my brothers!

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.
verses.web: For whoever does the will of God is my brother, my sister, and mother.”
verses.ct: Anyone who does the will of God — that person is my brother, my sister, and my mother."
